business.headline: ITR-1 and ITR-4 Excel utilities out: Check who can file and what's new this yearExcel utilities for ITR-1 and ITR-4 are now available for AY 2025–26. Taxpayers can visit the income tax e-filing site to download and use them for filing returns for FY 2024–25.
Gensol misses May payment for loan on BluSmart cabs: ReportGensol Engineering reportedly missed a payment of about Rs 4 crore to its pass-through certificate (PTC) holders in May.
India's economic growth hits 4-year low of 6.5% in FY25The real GDP growth for the March quarter (Q4) stood at 7.4%, which is the fastest among all four quarters of the year.
Sensex closes 182 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; IT stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 182 points to end at 81,451.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 82.90 points to close at 24,750.70.

From UPI withdrawals to online corrections: 5 expected features of EPFO 3.0EPFO's upcoming system aims to enhance financial flexibility for employees with features like instant UPI and ATM withdrawals, auto-claim settlements, and expanded withdrawal reasons.

Meet Leena Tewari, the USV chairperson who bought India's costliest flatsLeena is the chairperson of USV, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, which was started by her late father, Vithal Gandhi, in partnership with Revlon in 1961. Forbes estimates Leena's net worth at $3.9 billion, as of May 30, 2025, making her one of India's richest women.

Explained: Why Arshad Warsi, wife Maria Goretti were banned by Sebi for 1 yearArshad Warsi and Maria Goretti bought shares of Sadhna Broadcast Limited (now known as Crystal Business System Ltd) from other individuals who were also named in the Sebi order.

How Trump's tariff tsunami is reshaping global economyIn just over four months, Trump's flurry of trade actions, alternating between shock-and-awe tariffs and strategic pauses, has upended conventional expectations.

Waiting for Form 16? Here's when will you get it and what to checkEmployers are required to issue Form 16 to employees if they've deducted TDS from their salary. It consists of two parts and shows how much salary was paid and how much tax was deducted during the year.

Arshad Warsi, his wife, among 59 people banned from stock market for 1 yearSebi said the group was part of a scheme to artificially raise the price of Sadhna Broadcast shares before selling them to unsuspecting retail investors.

Veteran investor explains why most investors fail in marketsAce investor Shankar Sharma said many investors fail to ask tough questions and instead rely on myths. He was critical of the belief that great investors can see into the future, dismissing it as an unrealistic myth.

India GDP data to be released today: What should investors expect?Earlier this year, the National Statistical Office had estimated that India's economy would grow by 6.5% in 2024–25, with an expected growth of 7.6% in the March quarter.

entertainment.headline: South Indian Artistes Association backs Kamal Haasan amid language rowThe South Indian Artistes Association has strongly supported Kamal Haasan amid the recent backlash in Karnataka. The statement warns that misrepresenting Kamal could harm cinema's cultural unity and public discourse.

Thug Life and Vishwaroopam: Tale of two bans and Kamal Haasan's defianceKamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', directed by Mani Ratnam, has been banned in Karnataka. Twelve years ago, another film of the actor, 'Vishwaroopam', was also banned. Both times, Haasan remained unfazed.

Gigi and Bella Hadid introduce their 23-year-old half sister, Aydan NixSupermodel sisters, Gigi Hadid and Bella Hadid, have introduced their 23-year-old half-sister, Aydan Nix, who they connected with in 2023 after a surprise DNA test. Raised in Florida, Aydan is now pursuing a career in fashion after graduating from Parsons School of Design.

Criminal Justice 4 review: Stellar Pankaj Tripathi cross-examines average legal dramaReleased-Fri May 30, 2025In 'Criminal Justice Season 4', actor Pankaj Tripathi tries to hold the court in a murder case, but how much can he do alone? The story looks engaging in parts, but not fully convincing.

Mahesh Babu fan enters theatre with snake during Khaleja re-releaseA Mahesh Babu fan carried a live snake to theatres in Vijayawada as the actor's film 'Khaleja' re-released in theatres. A video of the incident has gone viral.

Hybe chairman investigated for alleged fraud before BTS comebackHybe chairman Bang Si-hyuk is under investigation for alleged fraudulent trading during the company's pre-IPO phase. The probe intensifies scrutiny as BTS prepares for its highly anticipated comeback.

Bhairavam review: A typical but good old-school Telugu commercial entertainerReleased-Fri May 30, 2025Bhairavam movie review: This Telugu family drama directed by Vijay Kanakamedala stars Manoj Manchu, Bellamkonda Sai Srinivas and Nara Rohith in the lead. The film packs a good emotional punch despite the template story, says our review.

Kankhajura review: Mohit-Roshan's thriller grips early but falters in climaxReleased-Fri May 30, 2025Kankhajura series review: 'Kankhajura' is a psychological thriller on SonyLiv that explores family tension and emotional manipulation. Despite strong performances, the series falters with a rushed and less impactful ending.

Alia Bhatt is a gorgeous bridesmaid in black for friend's white wedding in SpainActor Alia Bhatt radiated charm in a black outfit at her friend's white wedding in Spain. The pictures of her with the other bridesmaids have gone viral.

Actor Suriya to do Singam 4 next? Jyotika's now-deleted photo sparks rumoursJyotika shared a photo of Suriya in what appears to resemble his 'Singam' look from her daughter's graduation day. However, she quickly deleted the photo. Now, it has fuelled speculation about the actor's possible collaboration with director Hari for 'Singam 4.

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan gives off boss-lady vibes in new photos from Cannes 2025Aishwarya Rai Bachchan stunned in new photos from Cannes 2025. She gave powerful boss-lady vibes in a chic mauve pantsuit.

The Traitors trailer: KJo brings 20 contestants to compete in a high-voltage gameKaran Johar is set to host a new reality show 'The Traitors', premiering on Prime Video on June 12. Featuring 20 celebrities, the trailer promises intense drama, mind games, and thrilling twists.

Kamal Haasan's Thug Life banned in Karnataka amid Kannada language rowActor Kamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', has been banned by the Karnataka Film Chamber. This move came after the actor's 'Kannada is born out of Tamil' comment at the film's audio launch in Chennai on May 24.

Raj Kundra jokes about using nepo-husband card on The Traitors. WatchAt the trailer launch of The Traitors, Raj Kundra reflected on how public perception of his masked appearances might play to his advantage on the reality show. "Whenever I've worn a mask, people have wondered what I'm hiding. That mystery might help me in this game," he said. Calling The Traitors a show of deception and strategy, Kundra added with a laugh that he might even use the "nepo husband" card, since the show is hosted by his brother-in-law, Karan Kundrra.

Actor Surveen Chawla breaks silence on facing casting couch after marriageActor Surveen Chawla has opened up about facing casting couch experiences and inappropriate behaviour in the film industry, even after marriage. Despite these challenges, she continues to focus on her work and is set to appear in 'Rana Naidu' Season 2.
Ajay Devgn's Drishyam 3 in works? Viral post sparks buzzAjay Devgn's 'Drishyam 3' is believed to be in the works. A viral letter from the production house, Panorama Studios, has sparked buzz.

Uorfi, Raftaar to Rebel Kid: Meet 20 confirmed contestants for KJo's The TraitorsUorfi Javed, Raftaar and Apoorva Mukhija are among the confirmed celebs who are set to participate in Karan Johar's hosted, 'The Traitors'. The show will premiere on Prime Video on June 12.

Explained: Housefull 5's genius gamble of multiple climaxes, and how it works'Housefull 5' makers have introduced a new strategy - one film, multiple climaxes. But, what does this mean? How will it change the audiences' movie-watching experience?

Janhvi Kapoor likes reel questioning Madhuri Dixit's Filmfare win over SrideviJanhvi Kapoor sparked controversy after liking an Instagram reel that criticised Madhuri Dixit's Filmfare win and praised her late mother Sridevi's performance. The internet is divided, with many questioning whether the like was accidental or intentional.

general news.headline: Gave enemy sleepless nights: PM's Op Sindoor shoutout to BrahMosPM Modi spoke about India's growing defence manufacturing power, especially in Uttar Pradesh. He said the BrahMos missile that gave sleepless nights to the enemy during Operation Sindoor has its new address in Uttar Pradesh.

Kamal Haasan defiant amid Kannada row: Will only apologise if I am wrongVeteran actor Kamal Haasan refused to apologise for his remark that "Kannada was born out of Tamil," stressing that he would only do so if he was wrong.
India's economic growth hits 4-year low of 6.5% in FY25The real GDP growth for the March quarter (Q4) stood at 7.4%, which is the fastest among all four quarters of the year.

Not just water, money too flowed from India to Pakistan as part of Indus treatyFor a treaty hailed globally as a triumph of water diplomacy, India paid not just in rivers, but in rupees, following the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) with Pakistan of 1960. Behind the Indus treaty lies the lesser-known story of how India bankrolled Pakistan's water infrastructure, only to be repaid with hostility.

Colombia surprised Tharoor. Does its pro-Pak stance have China link?Colombia has expressed condolences over the loss of lives (read terrorists) in Pakistan after India's Operation Sindoor. It left Shashi Tharoor, who visited the country for global outreach, disappointed. Is there a China link to Colombia's pro-Pakistan stance?

PM Modi meets Vaibhav Suryavanshi after record-breaking IPL runIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Vaibhav Suryavanshi and his family after the 14-year-old batter had an incredible campaign for Rajasthan Royals in the Indian Premier League 2025.

Bomb threat to Nayab Singh Saini's office triggers security alert in ChandigarhChandigarh police are on alert after receiving a call threatening a bomb at Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini's office.

Deportation fears, rejections: How Indian students can stay ahead amid US visa jittersStudents are advised to maintain vigilance, academic discipline, a clean digital footprint, and a well-thought-out Plan B that includes Europe and the United Kingdom.

Thug Life and Vishwaroopam: Tale of two bans and Kamal Haasan's defianceKamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', directed by Mani Ratnam, has been banned in Karnataka. Twelve years ago, another film of the actor, 'Vishwaroopam', was also banned. Both times, Haasan remained unfazed.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

US pause on visa interviews worries Indian students, expert says relief soonThe US has paused visa interview scheduling for international students, creating uncertainty amongst students globally, especially in India, which makes up the biggest cohort of international students in the US. However, Viral Doshi, an educational consultant, suggests that once the US's social media guidance for vetting international students is updated, it will prioritise students who need to start their academic year in August or September.

Given choice to retreat amid Pak shelling, 7 BSF women sent enemy runningSeven BSF women defended two forward posts for three days in the Akhnoor Sector of Jammu and Kashmir amid intense shelling by Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. The all-woman team, led by Assistant Commandant Neha Bhandari, were offered the option to withdraw, but they not only defended the posts but sent Pakistani soldiers fleeing for their lives.

Rajasthan twins score identical 97.17% in Class 10 board resultIn what can only be described as an extraordinary coincidence, twin sisters Kanishka and Kartika Chaudhary, who've shared not just a birthday but also books, dreams, and late-night study sessions, have now added another identical milestone to their journey—scoring exactly 97.17% each in Rajasthan's Class 10 board exams.

Rajnath Singh praises Navy's role during Op Sindoor: Pak ships didn't dare...Defence Minister Rajnath Singh visited INS Vikrant in the Arabian Sea weeks after its lead role in Operation Sindoor, which pressured Pakistan into a ceasefire.

Get rich fast or die trying: India's choice is a no-brainerFor India that aspires to be powerful, it has to become filthy rich. Money can't buy you love, but it can buy aircraft carriers and friends. For the money, India needs reforms, and PM Modi will have to channel his inner Manmohan Singh, and not the inner Nehru.

Kamal Haasan's Thug Life banned in Karnataka amid Kannada language rowActor Kamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', has been banned by the Karnataka Film Chamber. This move came after the actor's 'Kannada is born out of Tamil' comment at the film's audio launch in Chennai on May 24.
Hindu Kush Himalaya could lose 75% of glaciers, billions at riskThis stark projection shows the region's vulnerability and the far-reaching consequences for water security across Asia.

PM's emotional meet with Pahalgam victim's family: Fight against terror not overThe emotional meeting with the wife and family of Shubham Dwivedi took place at Chakeri airport after PM Modi arrived in Kanpur for a day-long visit.
Indian man attacked by tiger while taking selfie in terrifying video from PhuketIn the viral video, the man is seen walking beside a tiger at the park before crouching to pose for a photograph.

'Should be deported': Vivek Ramaswamy's anniversary post faces racist backlashIndian-origin Republican leader Vivek Ramaswamy's anniversary post was bombarded with racist and anti-immigrant comments by X users over his views on the H-1B visa programme.

Odisha engineer throws cash out of window during raid, Rs 2 crore seizedOdisha Vigilance seized Rs 2.1 crore in unaccounted cash from Chief Engineer Baikuntha Nath Sarangi's properties during raids across Bhubaneswar.

Befriend, rape, blackmail: The MO of 'love jihad' gangs in BhopalThe modus operandi of these 'love jihad gangs' involve befriending unsuspecting Hindu girls, sexually exploiting them and then blackmailing them with obscene videos. A woman sub-inspector was among those trapped.

Chidiya review: Tender tale of dreams, resilience and family bondsReleased-Fri May 30, 2025Chidiya movie review: 'Chidiya' is a heartfelt film about two brothers facing early adulthood challenges in Mumbai. It explores dreams, family bonds, and the resilience needed to overcome life's hurdles.

sports.headline: Lorenzo Musetti, Aryna Sabalenka, Zheng Qinwen storm into last 16Top seeds Aryna Sabalenka, Lorenzo Musetti and Zheng Qinwen have all secured their spots in the fourth round at Roland Garros. Their performances highlight strong form and set up exciting clashes ahead in the tournament.

Massimiliano Allegri returns to AC Milan as head coach for 2nd timeAC Milan appointed Massimiliano Allegri as head coach on Friday, a day after sacking Sergio Conceicao, tasking the Italian with transforming the struggling club into title contenders in his second stint at the helm.

GT vs MI Live: Mumbai Indians opt to bat first in MullanpurGT (Gujarat Titans) vs MI (Mumbai Indians), IPL 2025 Eliminator, Live Updates: A depleted Mumbai Indians will face Shubman Gill's Gujarat Titans in the Eliminator of the Indian Premier League. GT, who also have key players missing, are expected to face a stern challenge against Jasprit Bumrah at the Mullanpur Stadium.

Pooja, 18, wins high jump gold, Gulveer Singh completes golden doubleAsian Athletics Championships 2025: 18-year-old Pooja won gold medal in women's high jump, bettering her personal best with an effort of 1.89m. Meanwhile, Gulveer Singh won 5,000m gold, days after he won the 10,000m event in Gumi, South Korea.

Asian Athletics: Nandini Agasara becomes third Indian to win Heptathlon goldIndia's Nandini Agasara has become the third Indian to claim the Asian Championships heptathlon gold, after Soma Biswas (2005) and Swapna Barman (2017).

Trent Alexander-Arnold joins Real Madrid after two decades at LiverpoolTrent Alexander-Arnold will join Real Madrid ahead of his Liverpool contract expiry. The early transfer deal enables him to play in the Club World Cup this June in the United States.

Singapore Open: Satwiksairaj, Chirag Shetty outclass World No.1 pair to reach semifinalsIndia's top men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty stormed into the Singapore Open semifinals with a straight-game win over the world No. 1 Malaysian duo of Goh Sze Fei and Nur Izzuddin.

If RCB have to win the IPL, Mumbai Indians shouldn't enter the final: R AshwinFormer India cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin feels Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) mustn't face Mumbai Indians (MI) if they're to win their maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title.

PM Narendra Modi meets Vaibhav Suryavanshi at Patna AirportIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met 14-year-old sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi and his family at the Patna Airport after the young batter broke multiple records while playing for the Rajasthan Royals in the Indian Premier League 2025.

Fan writes to Siddaramaiah asking for state holiday if RCB wins this IPLRCB fan from Belagavi, Karnataka, wrote a heartfelt letter to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah requesting the day RCB wins the IPL be declared "RCB Fans' Festival Day" as a public holiday. The handwritten letter went viral on social media.

Jasprit Bumrah on England's Bazball style: It's Interesting, but I don't fully get itStar India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has shared his thoughts on England's Bazball style, saying that he doesn't fully understand it, but it creates wicket-taking opportunities for opponents.

The handwritten letter went viral on social media.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
